did.abstract: Pat Schneider, a poet, author and writing teacher, is founder of Amherst Writers and Artists in Amherst, Massachusetts. Her papers include published and unpublished plays, autobiographical works, essays, Schneider's book, Writing Alone and With Others (2003), and a booklet of her poetry, The Patience of Ordinary Things (2003). Also included are several recordings of readings and some photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pat Schneider was born in 1934 in a St. Louis, MO, slum and was educated with money from a bequest to a nearby church. She received a B.A. from Central College, Fayette, MO (1956), a M.A. from Pacific School of Religion, Berkeley, CA (1959), and a M.F.A. in Creative Writing from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst (1979). At the time that she was completing her degree at Pacific School of Religion, she married a Methodist minister. They spent 15 years in an Amherst, MA parish with a strong outreach program. Ordered to cease and desist by the local Methodist district supervisor, she and her husband both left the church circa 1980. Schneider was an adjunct faculty member at Smith College School of Social Work and the Graduate Theological Union in Berkeley, CA. She has taught creative writing workshops at the University of Massachusetts and in Sligo and Dublin, Ireland. She has also been Playwright in Residence at Pacific School of Religion. A writer of fiction, non-fiction, poetry, and plays, Schneider is the founder/director of Amherst Writers and Artists, which sponsors several year-round workshops in creative writing. Her long time work with low-income families in mill town housing projects in the Connecticut River Valley has brought about the establishment of Amherst Writers and Artists Institute which sponsors free writing workshops for low-income women, children, and adolescents. The Institute has also sent children and single mothers to summer camp, assisted single mothers to resume their interrupted educations, and offers training in workshop leadership. Schneider has appeared on National Public Radio and has given presentations and trainings throughout the U.S., Ireland and in Japan.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pat Schneider papers, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00396, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers include published and unpublished writings by Pat Schneider include plays, autobiographical works, essays, Schneider's book, Writing Alone and With Others (2003), and a booklet of her poetry, The Patience of Ordinary Things (2003). There are also writings published by Amherst Writers and Artists; CD-Roms containing photographs of Schneider and others, and cover art for one of her books; DVDs of Schneider speaking in Amherst, and being interviewed in Dublin, Ireland; list of publications, recordings and play productions by Schneider; and a list that identifies people in group photo taken at Schneider's retirement party (on one of the CD-Roms). 2 signed broadsides of poems by Pat Schneider in flat file.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Pat Schneider has retained copyright to herself and her heirs in her works donated to Smith College. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For those few instances beyond fair use, or which may regard materials in the collection not created by Pat Schneider, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Her journals will be donated in the future and there will be restrictions on them.
